hr.fer.zemris.java.webserver

Class RequestContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • hr.fer.zemris.java.webserver.RequestContext

  • public class RequestContext
extends java.lang.Object
    Context of an internet request.

    Output given in the constructor should be Socket.getOutputStream() to work as intended. Saves cookies and manages the output to the Socket.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Juraj Pejnovic
    See Also:
    SmartHttpServer, Socket

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  RequestContext.RCCookie
      Cookie container used for marking web pages.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RequestContext

        public RequestContext(java.io.OutputStream stream,
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> persistentParameters,
                      java.util.List<RequestContext.RCCookie> outputCookies)
        Creates the context with the given parameters. Stream must not be null. Parameters, persistentParameters and outputCookies can be null. If null they are considered empty.
        Parameters:
        stream - stream to write to
        parameters - paramters to keep, can be null
        persistentParameters - persistent parameters to keep, can be null
        outputCookies - cookies to save, can be null

      • write

        public RequestContext write(byte[] data)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the given byte array to the output of the context. Also writes out the header if it already hasn't been written.
        Parameters:
        data - data to be written
        Returns:
        returns this context
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throw if unable to write to output

      • write

        public RequestContext write(java.lang.String text)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the given string in charset to the output of the context. Also writes out the header if it already hasn't been written.
        Parameters:
        text - text to be written
        Returns:
        returns this context
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throw if unable to write to output
